title: How would you complete this sentence, 'Gone are the days when ______'? - Quora

response.answer_text: When Black people would just accept racial profiling as a given by the Police. Gone are the days when a Black Male was brutally killed under the wheel of a Cop’s car with his knee pressed into his neck for 8 minutes and 46 seconds. Gone are the days when Black mothers saw their black sons being killed at an alarming rate, while no investigations were conducted and the mothers just had to accept the loss of their child.. Gone are the days when we sat down, and asked no questions about black people being discriminated against for fair housing, job discrimination, racial equality. We are now standing up, marching and protesting to just be treated as American citizens, and trying to eliminate systematic racism.. That is all that we are asking… Gone we can only hope and Pray.. For Good.. Peace Author Dia Stone BLM Washington DC Chapter

When_______ Joy of the postman to deliver letters to our houses was incredible.A cycle trip in the city with our childhood friends was the best adventure we used to have  (PS, I spent my childhood in a very small town).Whole family used to sit in front of T.V. on Sundays for  Doordarshan's 12:00 P.M. movie.We as children used to dream of being an adult just to feel how great and bold it would be.A 5rs note from our father in the morning after yesterday's night scolding and the words like "Beta have Samosa and Pani puri with this" would make us feel no less than Superman.Shaktiman and Chacha Chaudhary were our favorite T.V. shows.Sentences like "Mummy aaj school mein Anoop ne meri pencil tod di" ("Mummy, Anoop broke my pencil today") and then sobbing used to make sense than any other thing.Friendship was about this :   and "Atti Batti Sau (100) Din Ki Katti" (Only my Indian friends would understand this :P ) was equivalent to an Impending World War .He used to park his bicycle at the exact spot adjacent to where she had parked her bicycle because of 'that' glance of her after the school.Jagjit Singh's, Ghulam Ali's and Mehdi Hassan's concerts were recorded on Tape-recorders.Last but not the least,When..."Naa duniya ka gam tha naa rishton ke bandhan", Badi khubsoorat thi wo Zindagaani...
